alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued November 12 at 2:00PM CST until November 13 at 6:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...NEAR-CRITICAL TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS LIKELY MONDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS FAR SOUTHWEST NEBRASKA... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON FOR LOW HUMIDITY AND STRONG SOUTH WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 210... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Monday morning through Monday afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 210, Frenchman Basin across far southwest Nebraska. * TIMING...10 AM MDT until 5 PM MDT Monday * WIND...From the south at 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...as low as 14 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
